Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:105%;padding-left:12.72pt">During the first quarter of 2024, certain non-core assets were determined to meet the criteria for assets held for sale. As a result, the related </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:105%">Cash and cash equivalents</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:105%"> was reclassified to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:105%">Assets held for sale</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7pt;font-weight:400;line-height:105%">. Refer to Note 3 of the Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;19</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_34"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Non-GAAP Financial Measures </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Non-GAAP financial measures are intended to provide additional information only and do not have any standard meaning prescribed by GAAP. These measures should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. Unless otherwise noted, we present the Non-GAAP financial measures of our continuing operations in the tables below. </font></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_37"></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Adjusted Net Income (loss)</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Management uses Adjusted net income (loss) to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance and for planning and forecasting future business operations. The Company believes the use of Adjusted net income (loss) allows investors and analysts to understand the results of the continuing operations of the Company and its direct and indirect subsidiaries relating to the sale of products, by excluding certain items that have a disproportionate impact on our results for a particular period. Adjustments to continuing operations are presented before tax and net of our partners&#8217; noncontrolling interests, when applicable.&#160;The tax effect of adjustments is presented in the Tax effect of adjustments line and is calculated using the applicable tax rate. Management&#8217;s determination of the components of Adjusted net income (loss) are evaluated periodically and based, in part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> is reconciled to Adjusted net income (loss) as lower of carrying value or fair value in 2024. Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">For additional information regarding our discontinued operations, refer to Note 1 to our Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Adjusted net income (loss) per diluted share is calculated using diluted common shares, which are calculated in accordance with GAAP. For the year ended December&#160;31, 2023, potentially dilutive shares, which were insignificant, were excluded from the computation of diluted loss per common share attributable to Newmont stockholders in the Consolidated Statement of Operations as they were antidilutive. These shares were included in the computation of adjusted net income per diluted share for the year ended December&#160;31, 2023.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(4)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Impairment charges, net, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Impairment charges</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> represents non-cash write-downs of long-lived assets and goodwill. Refer to Note 7 to our Consolidated Financial Statements for further information. Amount is presented net of pre-tax income (loss) attributable to noncontrolling interests of $(3) for the three months and year ended December 31, 2023.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(5)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Reclamation and remediation charges, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Reclamation and remediation</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents revisions to the reclamation and remediation plans and cost estimates at the Company&#8217;s former operating properties and historic mining operations that have entered the closure phase and have no substantive future economic value. Refer to Note 6 to our Consolidated Financial Statements for further information.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(6)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Newcrest transaction and integration costs, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, represents costs incurred related to Newmont's acquisition of Newcrest completed in 2023 as well as subsequent integration costs. These costs primarily include $316 in relation to the stamp duty tax incurred in connection with the transaction for the three months and year ended December 31, 2023.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(7)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">(Gain) loss on asset and investment sales, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents the loss on the abandonment of the pyrite leach plant at Pe&#241;asquito offset by the net gain recognized on the exchange of Maverix shares and warrants to Triple flag and the subsequent sale of Triple Flag shares. For additional information, refer to Note 9 to our Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;21</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(8)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Change in fair value of investments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents unrealized gains and losses related to the Company's investment in current and non-current marketable and other equity securities. Adjusted net income (loss) has not been adjusted for $1 of incremental COVID-19 costs incurred as a result of actions taken to protect against the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic at our operational sites for the three months and year ended December 31, 2023. Refer to Note 8 to our Consolidated Financial Statements for further information.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font tax rate.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:9.56pt">Valuation allowance and other tax adjustments, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Income and mining tax benefit (expense)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, is recorded for items such as foreign tax credits, alternative minimum tax credits, capital losses, disallowed foreign losses, and the effects of changes in foreign currency exchange rates on deferred tax assets and deferred tax liabilities. The adjustment for the three months and year ended December 31, 2023 reflects the net increase or (decrease) to net operating losses, capital losses, tax credit carryovers, and other deferred tax assets subject to valuation allowance of $231 and $357, the effects of changes in foreign exchange rates on deferred tax assets and liabilities of $49 and $(3), net removal to the reserve for uncertain tax positions of $(46) and $(28), and other tax adjustments of $234 and $240.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;text-indent:18pt"><font><br></font></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_40"></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:9pt;text-indent:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Earnings before interest, taxes and depreciation and amortization and Adjusted earnings before interest, taxes and depreciation and amortization</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Management uses earnings before interest, taxes and depreciation and amortization (&#8220;EBITDA&#8221;) and EBITDA adjusted for non-core or certain items that have a disproportionate impact on our results for a particular period (&#8220;Adjusted EBITDA&#8221;) as non-GAAP measures to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance. EBITDA and Adjusted EBITDA do not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, net income (loss), operating income (loss), or cash flow from operations as those terms are defined by GAAP, and do not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. Although Adjusted EBITDA and similar measures are frequently used as measures of operations and the ability to meet debt service requirements by other companies, our calculation of Adjusted EBITDA is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. The Company believes that Adjusted EBITDA provides useful information to investors and others in understanding and evaluating our operating results in the same manner as our management and Board of Directors.&#160;Management&#8217;s determination of the components of&#160;Adjusted EBITDA&#160;are evaluated periodically and based, in part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts.&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#160;is reconciled to&#160;EBITDA&#160;and&#160;Adjusted and costs related to additional employee related accruals as a result of the Australian Fair Work legislation in 2023.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">(8)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.72pt">Restructuring and severance, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents severance and related costs associated with significant organizational and operating model changes implemented by the Company for all periods presented.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">(9)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.72pt">(Gain) loss on asset and investment sales, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents the loss on the abandonment of the near-pit sizing and conveying system at Pe&#241;asquito, partially offset by the gain recognized on the sale of the Streaming Credit Facility Agreement (&#34;SCFA&#34;) in 2024&#59; the impairment loss on the abandonment of the pyrite leach plant at Pe&#241;asquito offset by the net gain recognized on the exchange of Maverix shares and warrants to Triple flag and the subsequent sale of Triple Flag shares in 2023. For additional information, refer to Note 9 to our Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">(10)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:10.12pt">Gain on debt extinguishment, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents the net gain on the partial redemption of certain Senior Notes and losses on the debt tender offer and subsequent extinguishment of the 2023 Newmont Senior Notes in 2024. Refer to Note 20 to our Consolidated Financial Statements.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">(11)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:10.12pt">Pension settlements, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily represents pension settlement charges related to lump sum payments to participants in 2024 and lump sum payments to participants in 2023. Refer to Note 11 to our Consolidated Financial Statements for further information.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">(12)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:10.12pt">COVID-19 specific costs, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, primarily includes amounts distributed from Newmont Global Community Support Fund to help host communities, governments and employees combat the COVID-19 pandemic for all periods presented and includes incremental direct costs incurred as a result of actions taken to protect against the impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. Refer to Note 8 to our Consolidated Financial Statements for further information.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.55pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.44pt;vertical-align:baseline">(13)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:10.12pt">Other, included in </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other income (loss), net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, in 2023 represents income received during the first quarter of 2023 on the favorable settlement of certain matters that were outstanding at the time of sale of the related investment in 2022.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;23</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_43"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Free Cash Flow</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Management uses Free Cash Flow as a non-GAAP measure to analyze cash flows generated from operations. Free Cash Flow is </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> less </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities of discontinued operations</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> less </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Additions to property, plant and mine development</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> as presented on the Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows. The Company believes Free Cash Flow is also useful as one of the bases for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with its competitors. Although Free Cash Flow and similar measures are frequently used as measures of cash flows generated from operations by other companies, the Company&#8217;s calculation of Free Cash Flow is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The presentation of non-GAAP Free Cash Flow is not meant to be considered in isolation or as an alternative to net income as an indicator of the Company&#8217;s performance, or as an alternative to cash flows from operating activities as a measure of liquidity as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs.&#160;The Company&#8217;s definition of Free Cash Flow is limited in that it does not represent residual cash flows available for discretionary expenditures due to the fact that the measure does not deduct the payments required for debt service and other contractual obligations or payments made for business acquisitions. Therefore, the Company believes it is important to view Free Cash Flow as a measure that provides supplemental information to the Company&#8217;s Consolidated Statements of Cash Flows.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following table sets forth a reconciliation of Free Cash Flow, a non-GAAP financial measure, to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) operating activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measure most directly comparable to Free Cash Flow, as well as information regarding </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net cash provided by (used in) financing activities.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:9pt"><table 1pt"></td><td style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open 1pt"></td><td style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Net cash provided by (used in) investing activities</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> includes </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Additions to property, plant and mine development</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, which is included in the Company&#8217;s computation of Free Cash Flow.   </font></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_49"></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net Debt</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Management uses Net Debt to measure the Company&#8217;s liquidity and financial position. Net Debt is calculated as </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Debt</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Lease and other financing obligations</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> less </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Cash and cash equivalents</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, as presented on the Consolidated Balance Sheets. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Cash and cash equivalents</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> are subtracted from </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Debt</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Lease and other financing obligations </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">as these could be used to reduce the Company's debt obligations. The Company believes the use of Net Debt allows investors and others to evaluate financial flexibility and strength of the Company's balance sheet. Net Debt is intended to provide additional information only and does not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of liquidity prepared in accordance with GAAP. Other companies may calculate this measure differently. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following table sets forth a reconciliation of Net Debt, a non-GAAP financial measure, to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Debt</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Lease and other financing obligations</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, which the Company believes to be the GAAP financial measures most directly comparable to Net Debt.</font></div><div for sale. As a result, the related </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Cash and cash equivalents</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> was reclassified to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Assets held for sale</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. Refer to Note 3 of the Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;24</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_52"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Costs applicable to sales per ounce&#47;gold equivalent ounce </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Costs applicable to sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> per ounce&#47;gold equivalent ounce are non-GAAP financial measures. These measures are calculated by dividing the costs applicable to sales of gold and other metals by gold ounces or gold equivalent ounces sold, respectively. These measures are calculated for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. We believe that these measures provide additional information to management, investors and others that aids in the understanding of the economics of our operations and performance compared to other producers and provides investors visibility into the direct and indirect costs related to production, excluding depreciation and amortization, on a per ounce&#47;gold equivalent ounce basis. Costs applicable to sales per ounce&#47;gold equivalent ounce statistics are intended to provide additional information only and do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. The measures are not necessarily indicative of operating profit or cash flow from operations as determined under GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measures.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Costs applicable to sales per style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px #000000;padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,263&#160;</font></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,249&#160;</font></td><td style="border-top:1pt solid #000000;padding:2px 1pt 2px Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Gold sold (thousand ounces), NGM</font></td><td colspan="2" style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">273&#160;</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="2" style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">320&#160;</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="2" style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,036&#160;</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="2" style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,167&#160;</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">Costs applicable to sales per ounce, NGM </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.85pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-3.15pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font></div></td><td style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,177&#160;</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,125&#160;</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,219&#160;</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td style="padding:2px 0 2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">$</font></td><td style="padding:2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">1,070&#160;</font></td><td style="padding:2px 1pt 2px 0;text-align:right;vertical-align:bottom"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(1)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Excludes </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Depreciation and amortization</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Reclamation and remediation</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:4.87pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.62pt;vertical-align:baseline">(2)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:12.34pt">Per ounce measures may not recalculate due to rounding.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;25</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_55"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">All-In Sustaining Costs </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Current GAAP measures used in the mining industry, such as cost of goods sold, do not capture all of the expenditures incurred to discover, develop and sustain production. Therefore, Newmont calculates All-in sustaining costs (&#8220;AISC&#8221;) based on the definition published by the World Gold Council. The World Gold Council is a market development organization for the gold industry comprised of and funded by gold mining companies around the world and is a regulatory organization. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">AISC is a metric that expands on GAAP measures, such as cost of goods sold, and non-GAAP measures, such as costs applicable to sales per ounce, to provide visibility into the economics of our mining operations related to expenditures, operating performance and the ability to generate cash flow from our continuing operations. We believe that AISC is a non-GAAP measure that provides additional information to management, investors and others that aids in the understanding of the economics of our operations and performance compared to other producers and provides investors visibility by better defining the total costs associated with production.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">AISC amounts are intended to provide additional information only and do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. The measures are not necessarily indicative of operating profit or cash flow from operations as determined under GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently as a result of differences in the underlying accounting principles, policies applied and in accounting frameworks such as in IFRS, or by reflecting the benefit from selling non-gold metals as a reduction to AISC. Differences may also arise related to definitional differences of sustaining versus development (i.e. non-sustaining) activities based upon each company&#8217;s internal policies.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following disclosure provides information regarding the adjustments made in determining the AISC measure&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Costs applicable to sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. Includes all direct and indirect costs related to current production incurred to execute the current mine plan.&#160;We exclude certain exceptional or unusual amounts from&#160;CAS, such as significant revisions to recovery amounts.&#160;CAS includes by-product credits from certain metals obtained during the process of extracting and processing the primary ore-body. CAS is accounted for on an accrual basis and excludes&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Depreciation and amortization</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#160;and&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Reclamation and remediation</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">, which is consistent with our presentation of CAS on the Consolidated Statements of Operations. In determining AISC, only the CAS associated with producing and selling an ounce of gold is included in the measure. Therefore, the amount of gold CAS included in AISC is derived from the CAS presented in the Company&#8217;s Consolidated Statements of Operations less the amount of CAS attributable to the production of other metals. The other metals' CAS at those mine sites is disclosed in Note 4 to the Consolidated Financial Statements. The allocation of CAS between gold and other metals is based upon the relative sales value of gold and other metals produced during the period.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Reclamation costs</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. Includes accretion expense related to reclamation liabilities and the amortization of the related ARC for the Company&#8217;s operating properties. Accretion related to the reclamation liabilities and the amortization of the ARC assets for reclamation does not reflect annual cash outflows but are calculated in accordance with GAAP. The accretion and amortization reflect the periodic costs of reclamation associated with current production and are therefore included in the measure. The allocation of these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Advanced projects, research and development and exploration</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. Includes incurred expenses related to projects that are designed to sustain current production and exploration. We note that as current resources are depleted, exploration and advanced projects are necessary for us to replace the depleting reserves or enhance the recovery and processing of the current reserves to sustain production at existing operations. As these costs relate to sustaining our production, and are considered a continuing cost of a mining company, these costs are included in the AISC measure. These costs are derived from the&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Advanced projects, research and development</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> and </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Exploration</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> amounts presented in the Consolidated Statements of Operations less incurred expenses related to the development of new operations, or related to major projects at existing operations where these projects will materially benefit the operation in the future. The allocation of these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals. We also allocate these costs incurred at Corporate and Other using the proportion of CAS between gold and other metals. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">General and administrative</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. Includes costs related to administrative tasks not directly related to current production, but rather related to supporting our corporate structure and fulfilling our obligations to operate as a public company. Including these expenses in the AISC metric provides visibility of the impact that general and administrative activities have on current operations and profitability on a per ounce basis. We allocate these costs to gold and other metals at Corporate and Other using the proportion of CAS between gold and other metals.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. Excludes certain exceptional or unusual expenses, such as restructuring, as these are not indicative to sustaining our current operations. Furthermore, this adjustment to&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Other expense, net</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#160;is also consistent with the nature of the adjustments made to&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">&#160;as disclosed in the Company&#8217;s non-GAAP financial measure Adjusted net income (loss). The allocation of these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Treatment and refining costs</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. Includes costs paid to smelters for treatment and refining of our concentrates to produce the salable metal. These costs are presented net as a reduction of&#160;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Sales</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> on the Consolidated Statements of Operations. The allocation of </font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;26</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Sustaining capital and finance lease payments</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">. We determined sustaining capital and finance lease payments as those capital expenditures and finance lease payments that are necessary to maintain current production and execute the current mine plan. We determined development (i.e. non-sustaining) capital expenditures and finance lease payments to be those payments used to develop new operations or related to projects at existing operations where those projects will materially benefit the operation and are excluded from the calculation of AISC. The classification of sustaining and development capital projects and finance leases is based on a systematic review of our project portfolio in light of the nature of each project. Sustaining capital and finance lease payments are relevant to the AISC metric as these are needed to maintain the Company&#8217;s current operations and provide improved transparency related to our ability to finance these expenditures from current operations. The allocation of these costs to gold and other metals is determined using the same allocation used in the allocation of CAS between gold and other metals. We also allocate these costs incurred at Corporate and Other using the proportion of CAS between gold and other metals.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:17.650%"></td><td Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Reclamation Costs</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="text-align:center"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">Advanced Projects, Research and Development and Exploration</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:3.9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%;position:relative;top:-2.1pt;vertical-align:baseline">(4)</font></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:center;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:6pt;font-weight:700;line-height:100%">General and Administrative</font></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><div style="text-align:center"><font estimates of the components of the calculation. Estimates for each component of the forward-looking All-in sustaining costs per ounce are independently calculated and, as a result, the total All-in sustaining costs and the All-in sustaining costs per ounce may not sum to the component ranges. While a reconciliation to the most directly comparable GAAP measure has been provided for the 2025 AISC Gold Guidance on a consolidated basis, a reconciliation has not been provided on an individual site or project basis in reliance on Item 10(e)(1)(i)(B) of Regulation S-K because such reconciliation is not available without unreasonable efforts.</font></div><div Pueblo Viejo and Fruta del Norte.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;31</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_61"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA ratio</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Management uses net debt to Adjusted EBITDA as non-GAAP measures to evaluate the Company&#8217;s operating performance, including our ability to generate earnings sufficient to service our debt. Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA represents the ratio of the Company&#8217;s debt, net of cash and cash equivalents, to Adjusted EBITDA. Net debt to Adjusted EBITDA does not represent, and should not be considered an alternative to, net income (loss), operating income (loss), or cash flow from operations as those terms are defined by GAAP, and does not necessarily indicate whether cash flows will be sufficient to fund cash needs. Although Net Debt to Adjusted EBITDA&#160;and similar measures are frequently used as measures of operations and the ability to meet debt service requirements by other companies, our calculation of net debt to Adjusted EBITDA measure is not necessarily comparable to such other similarly titled captions of other companies. The Company believes that net debt to Adjusted EBITDA provides useful information to investors and others in understanding and evaluating our operating results in the same manner as our management and Board of Directors. Management&#8217;s determination of the components of net debt to Adjusted EBITDA is evaluated periodically and based, in part, on a review of non-GAAP financial measures used by mining industry analysts. Net income (loss) attributable to Newmont stockholders is reconciled to Adjusted EBITDA as follows&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><table style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:107%;padding-left:3.34pt">During the first quarter of 2024, certain non-core assets were determined to meet the criteria for assets held for sale. As a result, the related </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:107%">Cash and cash equivalents</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:107%"> was reclassified to </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:400;line-height:107%">Assets held for sale</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:7.5pt;font-weight:400;line-height:107%">. Refer to Note 3 of the Consolidated Financial Statements for additional information.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;32</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_64"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Net average realized price per ounce&#47; pound</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Average realized price per ounce&#47; pound are non-GAAP financial measures. The measures are calculated by dividing the net consolidated gold, copper, silver, lead and zinc sales by the consolidated gold ounces, copper pounds, silver ounces, lead pounds, and zinc pounds sold, respectively. These measures are calculated on a consistent basis for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. Average realized price per ounce&#47; pound statistics are intended to provide additional information only, do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. The measures are not necessarily indicative of operating profit or cash flow from operations as determined under GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measure&#58;</font></div><div Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%"> </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">71 thousand tonnes of copper, 49 thousand tonnes of lead, and 101 thousand tonnes of zinc. </font></div><div style="padding-left:18pt;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:5.2pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;position:relative;top:-2.8pt;vertical-align:baseline">(3)</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%;padding-left:11.97pt">Per ounce&#47;pound measures may not recalculate due to rounding.</font></div><div style="height:36pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#0c2b82;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">NEWMONT FOURTH QUARTER AND FULL YEAR 2024 RESULTS &#38; 2025 GUIDANCE &#124; NEWS RELEASE       &#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;36</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;</font></div></div></div><div id="i4180a81ed9264c4193d6c8201bd588df_67"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:36pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt;padding-left:18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-style:italic;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Gold by-product metrics </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Copper and silver are by-products often obtained during the process of extracting and processing the primary ore-body. In our GAAP Consolidated Financial Statements, the value of these by-products is recorded as a credit to our CAS and the value of the primary ore is recorded as Sales. In certain instances, copper, silver, lead, and zinc are co-products, or a significant resource in the primary ore-body, and the revenue is recorded as Sales in our GAAP Consolidated Financial Statements. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Gold by-product metrics are non-GAAP financial measures that serve as a basis for comparing the Company&#8217;s performance with certain competitors. As Newmont&#8217;s operations are primarily focused on gold production, &#8220;Gold by-product metrics&#8221; were developed to allow investors to view Sales, CAS per ounce, and AISC per ounce calculations that classify all copper, silver, lead, and zinc production as a by-product, even when copper, silver, lead, or zinc is a significant resource in the primary ore-body. These metrics are calculated by subtracting copper, silver, lead, and zinc sales recognized from Sales and including these amounts as offsets to CAS. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">Gold by-product metrics are calculated on a consistent basis for the periods presented on a consolidated basis. These metrics are intended to provide supplemental information only, do not have any standardized meaning prescribed by GAAP and should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for measures of performance prepared in accordance with GAAP. Other companies may calculate these measures differently as a result of differences in the underlying accounting principles, policies applied and in accounting frameworks, such as in IFRS.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:120%">The following tables reconcile these non-GAAP measures to the most directly comparable GAAP measures&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:9pt"><table Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Title&#58; Newmont Fourth Quarter and Full Year 2024 Results Conference Call</font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">URL&#58; https&#58;&#47;&#47;events.q4inc.com&#47;attendee&#47;950322846</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:12pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">The webcast materials will be available </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:115%">Thursday, February 20,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%"> after North American markets close, under the &#8220;Investor Relations&#8221; section of the Company&#8217;s website. Additionally, the conference call will be archived for a limited time on the Company&#8217;s website.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">About Newmont</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:115%">Newmont is the world&#8217;s leading gold company and a producer of copper, zinc, lead, and silver. The company&#8217;s world-class portfolio of assets, prospects and talent is anchored in favorable mining jurisdictions in Africa, Australia, Latin America &#38; Caribbean, North America, and Papua New Guinea. Newmont is the only gold producer listed in the S&#38;P 500 Index and is widely recognized for its principled environmental, social, and governance practices. Newmont is an industry leader in value creation, supported by robust safety standards, superior execution, and technical expertise. Founded in 1921, the company has been publicly traded since 1925.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Open Sans',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:112%">At Newmont, our purpose is to create value and improve lives through sustainable and responsible mining. To learn more about Newmont&#8217;s sustainability strategy and initiatives, go to www.newmont.com.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:9pt;margin-top:12pt"><table
